abstract: Colorado's health insurance exchange has big disparity in premium prices, highlighting volatility of health plans under Affordable Care Act; some insurers are experimenting with very low prices that might not be sustainable over several years, while residents in state's resort areas pay relatively high premiums.
lead_paragraph: At first glance, Colorado seems to be one of the federal law’s clearest success stories. But zoom in closer, and it is clear that a kind of pricing pandemonium is underway.

byline.contributor: Julia Turkewitz contributed reporting from Colorado
byline.original: By REED ABELSON and AGUSTIN ARMENDARIZ

snippet: At first glance, Colorado seems to be one of the federal law’s clearest success stories. But zoom in closer, and it is clear that a kind of pricing pandemonium is underway.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

headline.main: In Colorado, Disparity in Health Plan Prices Underscores Ambitions, and Limits, of Affordable Care Act
